RECREATIONAL.summary: It is legal for adults 21 and older to possess cannabis in Connecticut. As of July 1, 2021, adults may possess up to 1.5 ounces of cannabis in public and up to 5 ounces in a locked container at home or in a vehicle.
RECREATIONAL.gov_quote: As of July 1, 2021, possession and use of up to 1.5 oz of cannabis is legal. Connecticut residents may also store up to 5 oz in a locked container at home or transport it in a locked glovebox or trunk.
RECREATIONAL.validation_notes: Exact quote found verbatim on the official Connecticut state cannabis website. All legal facts confirmed. No changes made.
RECREATIONAL.question: Is it legal for adults to possess cannabis in the state of Connecticut?

RECREATIONAL_GROW.summary: It is legal for adults 21 and older to grow cannabis at home in Connecticut. As of July 1, 2023, adults may cultivate up to three mature and three immature cannabis plants per person, with a maximum of 12 plants per household, provided all plants are grown indoors, secured, and not visible from the street.

RECREATIONAL_PUBLIC.summary: Cannabis consumption at public businesses is prohibited in Connecticut under state law. Connecticut General Statutes Section 21a-279a prohibits the use of cannabis in any public place, which is defined broadly to include any area used by the public whether owned or operated by public or private interests. This includes all businesses open to the public such as restaurants, bars, retail stores, and other commercial establishments. The Department of Consumer Protection reinforces this prohibition, stating that cannabis cannot be consumed anywhere tobacco use is banned. No licenses exist for on-site consumption at businesses, and municipalities have authority to impose additional restrictions.
RECREATIONAL_PUBLIC.gov_quote: Except as provided in subsection (b) of this section, use or possession of cannabis by a person in any public place, as defined in section 21a-240, is prohibited. Public place means any area that is used or held out for use by the public whether owned or operated by public or private interests.
RECREATIONAL_PUBLIC.validation_notes: Exact quote found verbatim on page. Answer confirmed. No changes made.
RECREATIONAL_PUBLIC.question: Is it legal to consume cannabis at a public business in the state of Connecticut?

MEDICAL.gov_quote: Registered medical marijuana patients may have up to 5 ounces of medical marijuana per month.
MEDICAL.validation_notes: Exact quote found verbatim on the official Connecticut government page. The answer and summary are accurate. No changes required.
MEDICAL.question: Is it legal for medical marijuana patients to possess cannabis in the state of Connecticut?

MEDICAL_STORE.gov_quote: Qualifying patients and caregivers who are registered with the Department of Consumer Protection may purchase medical marijuana from a licensed dispensary facility or hybrid retailer in Connecticut.

MEDICAL_GROW.summary: It is legal for registered medical marijuana patients 18 years and older in Connecticut to grow cannabis at home. Patients may cultivate up to three mature and three immature plants, with a maximum of twelve plants per household, provided the plants are kept indoors, in a secure, locked area, and are not accessible to anyone other than the patient or their caregiver.
MEDICAL_GROW.gov_quote: Any qualifying patient who is eighteen years of age or older may cultivate up to three mature cannabis plants and three immature cannabis plants in the patient's primary residence at any given time, provided such plants are secure from access by any individual other than the patient or patient's caregiver and no more than twelve cannabis plants may be grown per household.
